Reduce dimensions of single-cell data

Source: R/preprocessing.R
reduce_dimensions.Rd

Performs dimensionality reduction using PCA and UMAP on a Seurat object. Optionally performs t-SNE analysis.

Usage

reduce_dimensions(seurat_object, perform_tsne = TRUE, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

seurat_object

A Seurat object containing preprocessed single-cell data.

perform_tsne

Logical indicating whether to perform t-SNE. Default is TRUE.

verbose

Logical. Whether to print progress messages (default: TRUE).

Value

A Seurat object with PCA and UMAP coordinates added to metadata. If perform_tsne is TRUE, t-SNE coordinates are also added.

Examples

# Create mock Seurat object with enough cells for PCA
library(Seurat)
counts <- matrix(rpois(100000, 5), nrow = 200, ncol = 500)
rownames(counts) <- paste0("Gene", seq_len(200))
colnames(counts) <- paste0("Cell", seq_len(500))
seurat_obj <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = counts)
#> Warning: Data is of class matrix. Coercing to dgCMatrix.

# Preprocess the data first (required for PCA)
seurat_obj <- NormalizeData(seurat_obj, verbose = FALSE)
seurat_obj <- FindVariableFeatures(seurat_obj, verbose = FALSE)
seurat_obj <- ScaleData(seurat_obj, verbose = FALSE)

# Run dimensionality reduction
seurat_obj_reduced <- reduce_dimensions(seurat_obj, perform_tsne = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)
#> Warning: The default method for RunUMAP has changed from calling Python UMAP via reticulate to the R-native UWOT using the cosine metric
#> To use Python UMAP via reticulate, set umap.method to 'umap-learn' and metric to 'correlation'
